com.magnet.spi

Interface ServiceDecorator<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PlatformProvider, ServiceProvider

    @Contract
public interface ServiceDecorator<T>
extends ServiceProvider
    Represents an Decorator.

    Decorators are useful for augmenting the call sequence in order to provide more robust data (e.g., analyzing the arguments and providing default values), or additional contextual information to the call (e.g., adding notes to the contextual data in InvocationContext.

    Exceptions thrown by decorators are logged and swallowed since they are not privileged to affect flow of execution. In this way they are different from ServiceInterceptors and ServiceValidators since they can affect call flow.

    Strictly speaking, all provider types that flow through the calling sequence can act like a decorator, but it is not a best practice to have other providers behaving as a decorator.

    Decorators are called immediately after ServiceInterceptors but before any ServiceValidator.

    See Also:
    ServiceProvider
